meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a periscope.
meanings.sent1: The periscopic device allowed the submarine crew to see above the water's surface.
meanings.sent2: The periscopic viewfinder on the camera helped the photographer capture unique angles.
meanings.sent3: The periscopic design of the glasses made everyone look like they were underwater explorers.
meanings.sent4: Her periscopic vision of the situation helped her anticipate problems before they arose.
meanings.sent5: The periscopic nature of the telescope revealed distant galaxies in stunning detail.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to see around obstacles or corners.
meanings.sent1: The periscopic mirror in the car allowed the driver to check blind spots easily.
meanings.sent2: The periscopic security camera could monitor all areas of the building without blind spots.
meanings.sent3: The periscopic cat toy made it seem like the feline could see through walls.
meanings.sent4: His periscopic insight into the problem helped him find a solution others had missed.
meanings.sent5: The periscopic drone provided a bird's-eye view of the entire landscape.
